name: "Back to the Future: The Game" Chapter 3 Online Trivia  | 10 Questions
tags: Back to the Future: The Game

questions.text: The game opens with the DeLorean returning to the "present", which was 1986. There was a woman doing community service for what crime?
questions.explanation:
Vandalism.

	She was picking up litter in the park near the Hill Valley sign. On the trashcan she was using was was a sign that read "I'm performing community service for vandalism". The DeLorean crashed into a sign with Doc. Brown on it. She was listed as "Delinquent Rocker Chick" instead of a name. Later we learn that the girl is Jennifer, Marty's girlfriend.

questions.text: What did Marty trade to Jennifer for the tire iron he used to escape the crashed DeLorean?
questions.explanation:
Kid Tannen's flask.

	It was nearly empty. She traded him the tire iron for the flask he had acquired while in 1932 in the previous chapter of the game. Soon after Marty escaped the car came crashing down from the billboard and ended up in a heap, unusable.

questions.text: Hill Valley was surrounded by a giant wall, how did Marty get inside the gate?
questions.correct: Used a hovertire from the wrecked car
options: Found a section that was damaged
questions.explanation:
Used a hovertire from the wrecked car.

	He used the tire iron to remove the right front wheel, and then took a 12 volt battery out of the wreckage. He powered up the tire, flew over the wall and then watched as the tire floated away from him.

questions.text: Why did officer Parker accuse Marty of being "on the pot"?
questions.correct: He wasn't wearing a polo shirt.
questions.explanation:
He wasn't wearing a polo shirt.

	In the new version of 1986, every citizen had to wear a polo shirt on Thursdays. Officer Brown also told him he was missing his name tag, which was also a violation. Marty was wearing his signature orange vest, button up shirt and t-shirt under that.

questions.text: What was the name of the brainwashing program being run in Hill Valley?
questions.explanation:
Citizen Plus.

	he program involved hypno-therapy being used to make people physically unable to break the rules. Biff Tannen was the first person in the program. He was turned into a model citizen instead of the heavy drinking, fighting small-time criminal he was in the regular timeline.

questions.text: Everyone in Hill Valley was forced to use bicycles as the main mode of transportation.
questions.explanation:
False.

	They used electric cars or golf carts to get around. Combustion engines were outlawed within the city.

questions.text: What did Lorraine McFly have hidden in the park?
options: A picture of her breaking into a bank
questions.explanation:
A flask.

	She was a known drunk. George was upset that if she were caught drinking again the entire family would get in trouble. He was spying on her using cameras set up all over the city.

questions.text: Who was Doc Brown married to in the alternate timeline?
questions.explanation:
Edna.

	She was still very much against booze, this time having it outlawed in the city rather than just running a group to encourage less drinking. She was there when Officer Parker caught Marty with the flask and she demanded he be demerited heavily.

Leech.

	He was a bully at school in his regular timeline. In this timeline he ran the soup restaurant. Marty tried to beat him in a guitar playing contest but lost when Leech cut the cord. Marty then had to watch as Leech and Jennifer kissed. When they had a rematch Marty won and ends up getting Jennifer to kiss him in front of Edna. Kissing in public was also against the rules.

questions.text: How many demerits did Marty earn in his first day in the alternate 1986?
questions.explanation:
Over 15,000.

	He was caught with booze, a dog, and kissing in public. All three were major crimes. He was also ticketed for loitering, and playing with the statue. All of this finally earned him a visit with Citizen Brown.
